title: Georgia runoff: Why one Senate seat is crucial for Democrats
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democrats have secured their majority in the Senate for the next two years. But holding on to Democratic Sen.

title: Obama to campaign for Warnock on Dec. 1 before Ga. runoff
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — Former President Barack Obama, reprising his battleground blitz ahead of the midterm elections, will campaign again for Sen. Raphael Warnock as the Georgia Democrat tries to withstand a strong challenge from Republican Herschel Walker before their Dec.

title: GOP’s lackluster fundraising spurs post-election infighting
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Trailing badly in his Arizona Senate race as votes poured in, Republican Blake Masters went on Tucker Carlson’s Fox News program and assigned blame to one person: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell.

title: Georgia court declines to halt Saturday early runoff voting
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — A Georgia appeals court ruling on Monday means that counties can offer early voting this coming Saturday in the U.S. Senate runoff election between Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican Herschel Walker.

title: Jan. 6 sedition trial of Oath Keepers founder goes to jury
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — As angry supporters of President Donald Trump stormed the U.S. Capitol, ready to smash through windows and beat police officers, Oath Keepers founder Stewart Rhodes extolled them as patriots and harkened back to the battle that kicked off the American Revolutionary War.

title: 2nd Arizona county delays certifying election, for now
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — A second Republican-controlled Arizona county on Monday delayed certifying the results of this month's election as a protest against voting issues in Maricopa County that some GOP officials have blamed for their losses in top races including the contest for governor.

title: GOP sees slight Latino vote gains, painful candidate losses
shortDescription: MIAMI (AP) — Republicans had placed hopes on a roster of Latina candidates around the country as they looked to make gains with Latino voters in a midterm election that some had predicted would yield sweeping GOP victories.

title: Biden opens holidays, pardons turkeys Chocolate and Chip
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden continued a 75-year tradition Monday and pardoned a pair of Thanksgiving turkeys named after his favorite flavor of ice cream while cracking jokes about his political party's better-than-expected performance in this month's midterm elections.

title: Lawmakers urge action after report of other high court leak
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee said his panel is reviewing “serious allegations” in a report that a former anti-abortion leader knew in advance the outcome of a 2014 Supreme Court case involving health care coverage of contraception.

title: Trump’s growing GOP challengers revive fears of 2016 repeat
shortDescription: LAS VEGAS (AP) — Memories of the tumultuous 2016 Republican primary hung over the Las Vegas ballroom this weekend during the first major gathering of the party's potential contenders for the 2024 nomination.

title: Democratic U.S. Rep. Gomez triumphs in California district
shortDescription: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Democratic U.S. Rep. Jimmy Gomez defeated rival Democrat David Kim on Saturday in a Los Angeles district after a battle on the party’s progressive flank.With nearly all the ballots counted, Gomez had 51.3% to 48.7% for Kim, or a margin of about 3,000 votes.

title: Walker, Kemp campaign in Ga. together for the 1st time
shortDescription: SMYRNA, Ga. (AP) — Fresh off his commanding reelection, Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp on Saturday played the role of dutiful Republican soldier as he campaigned for the first time alongside Senate hopeful Herschel Walker after spending months steering clear of his ticket-mate.

title: NC Democrats’ parity in Congress delegation may be fleeting
shortDescription: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) — Democrats celebrated winning what was billed as North Carolina's lone toss-up race for the U.S. House this month, as state Sen. Wiley Nickel’s narrow victory over Republican Bo Hines in the 13th Congressional District helped weaken any national GOP midterm wave.

title: House GOP pushes Hunter Biden probe despite thin majority
Officials: Georgia audit confirms secretary of state winner
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — A hand count of random batches of votes in Georgia's recent election for secretary of state has confirmed Republican Brad Raffensperger's victory, state election officials said.The audit — required by state law — turned up a small difference in votes from the machine count used during the election, but the difference was well within the expected margin of error, the Secretary of State's office announced Friday.

title: Jeffries makes historic bid to lead House Dems after Pelosi
shortDescription: NEW YORK (AP) — A day after Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she would step aside, Rep.

title: Election conspiracists claim some races for local offices
shortDescription: As voting experts cheered the losses of election conspiracy theorists in numerous high-profile races on Election Day, Paddy McGuire prepared to hand over his office to one of them.

title: Trump 2024 rivals court his donors at big Las Vegas meeting
shortDescription: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The Republican Party's nascent 2024 class, emboldened as ever, openly cast Donald Trump as "a loser” over and over on Friday as they courted donors and activists fretting about the GOP's future under the former president's leadership.

title: Election certification avoiding chaos, except in Arizona
shortDescription: SANTA FE, N.M. (AP) — Certification of this year's midterm election results appears to be proceeding smoothly with little controversy across the country, with a small Arizona county being a rare exception, calming fears that local commissions consumed by talk of election conspiracies would create chaos by refusing to validate the will of the voters.

title: Frisch concedes race against Boebert as it goes to recount
shortDescription: DENVER (AP) — While conceding his tight U.S. House race to Republican Lauren Boebert, Democrat Adam Frisch said on Friday that his surprisingly strong campaign showed just how tired many GOP voters are of Boebert's brash style.

title: Feds: Oath Keepers sought ‘violent overthrow’ of government
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — For weeks leading up to Jan. 6, 2021, Oath Keepers founder Stewart Rhodes and four associates discussed using violence to overturn the results of the 2020 election, and when rioters started storming the Capitol they saw an opportunity to do it, a federal prosecutor told jurors Friday as the seditious conspiracy case wound toward a close.

title: Judge says Georgia law allows Saturday voting for runoff
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — A judge on Friday said Georgia law allows counties to offer early voting on the Saturday after Thanksgiving, which is the only possibility for Saturday voting before next month's Senate runoff election between Democratic Sen Raphael Warnock and Republican Herschel Walker.

title: Man who blamed Trump’s ‘orders’ for Jan. 6 riot sentenced
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — A federal judge on Friday sentenced an Ohio man who claimed he was only “following presidential orders” from Donald Trump when he stormed the U.S. Capitol to 3 years in prison.Dustin Byron Thompson was convicted in April by a jury that took less than three hours to reject his novel defense for obstructing Congress from certifying Joe Biden’s presidential victory.

title: Pelosi to step down from House leadership, stay in Congress
Lengthy vote counts frustrate, but don’t signal problems
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — Four days after Election Day, with a bitter, high-profile race for Arizona governor still up in the air, Ohio's secretary of state broke an unspoken protocol among top election officials.

title: OnPolitics Q&A: McCarthy's promise to keep 3 Dems out of committees
shortDescription: McCarthy has targeted Reps. Ilhan Omar (House Foreign Affairs Committee), Adam Schiff and Eric Swalwell (House Intelligence Committee).

title: Campaign shift? U.S. Senate candidates Warnock, Walker adjust messages
shortDescription: With just weeks allotted for the Georgia runoff, Raphael Warnock and Herschel Walker are adjusting their strategies for the final leg of the campaign.

title: McCarthy wants to block 3 Democrats from committees if he becomes speaker
shortDescription: Democrats said McCarthy will do whatever his right wing wants him to do because he still lacks the votes to land the speaker's job.

title: Biden at 80: President hits milestone amid questions about reelection bid
shortDescription: Joe Biden, already the nation's oldest president, is the first octogenarian to serve as commander in chief. Will he run for a second term?

title: Beyond the school boards: How education fared in the midterm elections
shortDescription: Support for parents' rights candidates was underwhelming, while campaigns promising more education funding and school choice secured victories.

title: GOP, Dems divided over Musk unbanning Trump on Twitter
shortDescription: Elon Musk reinstated former President Donald Trump's Twitter account Saturday night after a nearly two-year ban, spurring mixed reactions.

title: The week in politics: Republicans take House, Democratic leadership shift
shortDescription: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she was stepping down from Democratic leadership. Donald Trump announced he's running for president. Plus more.

title: Obama say Democrats can thank young voters for their midterm victories
shortDescription: Former President Barack Obama attributed Democratic midterm election wins to a voter base that historically weren't counted on: young voters

title: More Senate Democrats Seek Investigation of Tech Firm Accused of Colluding With Landlords to Hike Apartment Rents
shortDescription: Sen. Amy Klobuchar and other leading Democrats have asked the Department of Justice to examine Texas-based RealPage, which sells software to help landlords set apartment rental prices across the country.

title: Public Schools Are NYC’s Main Youth Mental Health System — and They’re Devastatingly Unequal
shortDescription: Most kids labeled as having an “emotional disability” and shunted into public special education schools are Black or Latino, and low income — while wealthier families more often access a taxpayer-funded free private education.

title: “We Need to Defend This Law”: Inside an Anti-Abortion Meeting With Tennessee’s GOP Lawmakers
shortDescription: Anti-abortion groups helped write and pass laws that kicked in to ban abortion when Roe v. Wade was overturned. The groups see Tennessee’s ban as the country’s strongest — and they want to keep it that way, according to audio reviewed by ProPublica.

title: How Democrats Can Fight a Crazy G.O.P.
shortDescription: They can forestall sabotage and make saboteurs pay a price.By Paul Krugman

title: Democratic Senate Loss in Ohio Raises Bar for Sherrod Brown in 2024
shortDescription: Tim Ryan’s loss to J. D. Vance is another reminder that Ohio is no longer a swing state. Can Mr. Brown, the Democratic incumbent, hold the seat in what’s shaping up as a crucial Senate election in 2024?By Trip Gabriel

title: Georgia Senate Rivals, With Little Time to Spare, Sprint Toward Runoff
shortDescription: Herschel Walker and Senator Raphael Warnock have only a few weeks to campaign, and Senate control is no longer at stake — which has both scrambled the race and left it largely unchanged.By Maya King

title: Brooklyn’s in the House. And the Senate.
shortDescription: With Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer poised to lead the Democrats in Washington, the New York borough that they live in enters the political spotlight.By Dodai Stewart

title: A Georgia judge allows another Saturday of early voting in the Senate runoff, a victory for Democrats.
shortDescription: Democrats had argued that a 2016 state law restricting early voting on a Saturday near a federal holiday, in this case Thanksgiving, would unfairly disenfranchise voters in the state’s runoff election for Senate.By Maya King

title: Dems get in array on future leadership after Pelosi departs
shortDescription: Lawmakers have managed to stealthily defuse rivalries for nearly every position at the top of the House caucus, despite their three major leadership retirements.

title: Democrats confront bleak odds for immigration deal before 2023
GOP centrists prepare to ‘flex our muscles’
GOP centrists prepare to ‘flex our muscles’
